td.content: s:pt presents with 4 months history of severe regurgitation. patient is a 37 yo F psychiatrist. she does not smoke drinks daily o:Height 62 in, Weight 131 lbs, Temperature 98.4 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, CBC Hgb=11 g/dL,Hct=31 %, Barium Esophagogram shows 2 cm stricture touching the gastroesophageal sphincter with small hiatal hernia, Neuro = alert and oriented x 3, CN 2-12 intact a:GERD p:administered ACIPHEX - 20 mg po bid x 8 weeks, performed CBC, Barium Esophagogram, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:pt presents with mild burning pain in the middle of the chest that usually occurs after eating or when lying down, mild nausea x 7 weeks. patient also reports chronic mild heart burn. she is a 38 yo f psychiatrist. she denies smoking she drinks 2 beers per night o:Height 62 in, Weight 131 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 19, Patient appears in mild discomfort a:GERD p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed RANITIDINE - 150 mg po bid x 4 weeks, and ordered CBC.
